history_of_present_illness.symptom_details: Patient reports drinking nearly 2 gallons of water daily and waking up 4 times a night to urinate.
history_of_present_illness.fatigue_details: Significant lethargy over the past month, even after 8 hours of sleep.
history_of_present_illness.onset_duration_severity: Symptoms have gradually progressed over the last 6 weeks.
history_of_present_illness.associated_symptoms: Blurred vision and a 5lb unintentional weight loss.

S.past_medical_history: History of hypertension and high cholesterol.
S.social_history: Sedentary lifestyle; family history of Type 2 Diabetes (Father).

O.physical_exam: Dry mucous membranes. Skin exam shows acanthosis nigricans (darkening) around the posterior neck.

A.preliminary_assessment: Clinical presentation and random glucose reading strongly suggest New-Onset Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus. Symptoms of blurred vision and weight loss indicate a state of significant insulin resistance/deficiency.

recommendations: Order Hemoglobin A1c, Fasting Plasma Glucose, and Basic Metabolic Panel (BMP).
Urinalysis to check for ketones and glucose.
Referral to a registered dietitian for medical nutrition therapy.
P.education: Educated patient on the importance of hydration with water (avoiding sugary drinks) and the need for immediate follow-up if vomiting or confusion occurs.
